subject: Art & Design
title: Photo Essays: Telling Stories in Sequences
description: A short lesson to help you apply Photo Essays: Telling Stories in Sequences.

hook.text: W. Eugene Smith's 'Country Doctor' essay (1948) followed a rural doctor for weeks. The sequence became legendary.

buildup.text: A photo essay uses a sequence of images to tell a complete story ‚Äî beginning, middle, end.

discovery.text: Each image serves a role: establishing shot, detail shot, portrait, action, and closing image.

twist.text: The order of images matters as much as the images themselves. Sequencing creates rhythm and pacing.

climax.text: National Geographic, Life, and Time built their empires on photo essays. The format defined photojournalism.

punchline.text: One photo captures a moment. A sequence captures a world.

quiz.question: What distinguishes a photo essay from a single photograph?
options: A sequence of images tells a complete story with beginning, middle, and end
Photo essays use only black and white photos
Each photo in an essay must be taken on the same day
